summary:
The Warren.
A modest player home deep under the Skyforge with tunnel exits to Whiterun and outside to the east and west.
descriptionHtml:
[size=6][color=lightblue]The Warren.[/color][/size]

[color=orange]*** Please read my sticky post in the comments section before you update.***[/color]

I have created a modest player home situated deep under the Skyforge in Whiterun.
The main entrance in Whiterun is through a door up on the bank behind the statue of Talos. The key is under the bench by the door.
Tunnels lead to the home and also to trapdoors on the east and west sides of Whiterun. I have found it tedious always having to run around to the main gate when approaching from the northern side.

The home consists of four rooms:-
A living-room with cooking, enchanting and alchemy facilities.
A work-room with anvil, armor workbench, sharpening wheel, tanning rack and wood chopping block. There are some barrels and storage.
One bedroom with single beds for four followers.
The master bedroom with a double bed, storage and bookcase.
I wanted to keep it relatively simple, so have not included mannequins and weapon racks which I tend not to use anyway.

I have given 'The Warren' a fairly dark lighting scheme as it is all under ground and therefore has no external ambient light, although you can find your way around without a torch or lantern.
Screen shots were taken using ELFX and COT.
Please let me know if it is too dark for your settings and I will try to help.

As far as I can tell this mod should only be incompatible with mods that change Whiterun in the areas where I have added structures. Again, let me know if you find any issues.
No other mods or DLCs are needed.
I use SKSE in game and have not tested without it.
Cleaned with TES5Edit.

To Install use NMM or download manually and copy 'TheWarren.esp' to your Skyrim/Data folder.
Don't forget to activate the mod in NMM or in your game launcher!
To Uninstall use NMM or delete 'TheWarren.esp' from your Skyrim/Data folder.

This is my first attempt at a mod so please be forgiving of any problems. I hope you enjoy it.
Don't forget to come back and endorse if you do!

Thanks for looking!
Thanks also to Bethesda for Skyrim and the Creation Kit, and Nexus for a fantastic site.
author: Skyrabbit
